intro: Senecio scheuchzeri, commonly known as the Alpine groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cold, rocky soils. Senecio scheuchzeri is considered a rare and specialized species, often found in specific microhabitats within mountain ranges.
